meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>melt</kanji> and this word means <vocabulary>to melt something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to melt</vocabulary>. You're doing the melting, and you know it because you are the <reading>cause</reading> (かす) of the melting.
readingMnemonic: The thing that you melted in this situation is your <reading>toe</reading> (と). Feel your toe getting melted away. Augghh it hurts.
